vertex_colour: If your defined vertex format takes a colour value you can use this function to add that data to the vertex being defined for the current primitive. The function needs a buffer to store the data in and will take either a colour constant, or a hex value (using the standard GameMaker Studio 2 format of BGR, eg: $FF0000 for blue) as well as an alpha value from 0 (transparent) to 1 (fully opaque).
The buffer to write the information to.
The colour for this vertex (can be a constant or a hex value).
The alpha value for the vertex (from 0 to 1).
The above code will set the vertex being defined to be white with an alpha value of 1.
